Ingest_LDD.name: Imaging
Ingest_LDD.full_name: R. Joyner, Jordan Padams, E. Rye, C. De Cesare
Ingest_LDD.comment:
This dictionary contains high level classes and attributes used in imaging and spectrometer products. It also contains classes with attributes used during active mission operations. Many of these classes are designed to be extended into local mission dictionaries.
## CHANGE LOG ## 1.4.0.0 - upgraded to v1900 of the IM - removed specific Autoexposure algorithm classes and introduced generic Algorithm_Parameter class - new/improved definitions for Companding_Parameters, Downsampling_Parameters, Exposure_Parameters - removed the following attributes: Data_Correction.data_correction_subtype - removed the following classes because they were insufficiently multi-mission: - Derived_Product_Parameters - Frame_Parameters - Product_Identification - Stereo_Product_Parameters - Vector_Range_Origin - added exposure_type enumeration - new flat_field_algorithm attribute - changed compression_type to compression_class and compression_mode_name to compression_type - added new enumerations for compression_class and compression_type - added new Instrument_Device_Currents class
1.5.0.0 - upgraded to v1A10 of the IM - removed old blocks of commented out XML
1.5.1.0 - changed unit of bandwidth attribute from Units_of_Frequency to Units_of_Length
1.6.0.0 -

DD_Attribute.name: active_flag
DD_Attribute.definition: The active_flag attribute indicates whether or not the data processing described by the parent class is active. In general this should be true (and should be assumed to be true if active_flag is not present), with the corresponding class simply being omitted if the correction does not apply. However, it may be useful in some cases to record a correction that was previously done to the data which may no longer apply (for example, a radiometric correction done before a stereo correlation operation; radiometric correction is no longer an attribute of stereo correlation results, but the fact that corrected data were used in the correlation may be of interest).

DD_Attribute.name: analog_offset
DD_Attribute.definition: The analog_offset attribute identifies the analog value that is subtracted from the signal prior to the analog/digital conversion.

DD_Attribute.name: autoexposure_algorithm_name
DD_Attribute.definition: The autoexposure_algorithm_name attribute provides the algorithm used for histogram thresholding or autoexposure of the image. Some example algorithms from past missions are, 'Maki 2003' used on MER cameras, MSL ECAMs, M2020 EECAMs; 'Maurice 2012' used on MSL ChemCam; 'Smith 1997' used on Mars Pathfinder Imager.

DD_Attribute.name: autofocus_step_count
DD_Attribute.definition: The autofocus_step_count attribute specifies the number of steps (images) to be taken by an autofocus algorithm.

DD_Attribute.name: autofocus_step_size
DD_Attribute.definition: The autofocus_step_size attribute specifies the size in motor counts of each (or the initial) step taken by the focus adjustment mechanism in an autofocus algorithm.

DD_Attribute.name: bandwidth
DD_Attribute.definition: The bandwidth attribute provides a measure of the spectral width of a filter. For a root-mean-square detector this is the effective bandwidth of the filter, i.e. the full width of an ideal square filter having a flat response over the bandwidth and zero response elsewhere. Another common method for measuring bandwidth is Full Width at Half Maximum, which is the width of a "bump" on a curve or function. It is given by the distance between points on the curve at which the function reaches half of its maximum value.

DD_Attribute.name: best_focus_distance
DD_Attribute.definition: The best_focus_distance attribute specifies the estimated distance to best focus.

DD_Attribute.name: center_filter_wavelength
DD_Attribute.definition: The center_filter_wavelength attribute provides the wavelength of the center of the passband, or the peak transmissivity, for an instrument filter.

DD_Attribute.name: color_component
DD_Attribute.definition: For single-band images, this defines which component of the color space is represented by this band. This keyword is not needed for 3-band images, as all bands are represented.

DD_Permissible_Value.value_meaning: Used for 3-band images, or (preferred) the keyword may be absent.
Red band of one of the RGB types.
Green band of one of the RGB types.
Blue band of one of the RGB types.
X (uppercase) value of CIE_XYZ.
Y (uppercase) value of CIE_XYZ.
Z (uppercase) value of CIE_XYZ.
x (lowercase) value of CIE_xyY.
y (lowercase) value of CIE_xyY.
Capital Y value of CIE_xyY. The Y is repeated in order to distinguish it from xyY_y on a case-insensitive basis.
Hue component of HSI
Saturation component of HSI
Intensity component of HSI

DD_Attribute.name: color_filter_array_state
DD_Attribute.definition: Specifies whether the image still has a CFA pattern ("Encoded"), the CFA pattern has been removed ("Decoded") or it never had a pattern ("No CFA").

DD_Permissible_Value.value_meaning: Indicates the CFA pattern is still present in the image. The image should be a single band, with each pixel containing the appropriate color value as determined by the color_filter_array_type. An encoded image is not directly viewable as color; it must be decoded first.

Indicates the image has been processed such that it no longer contains the CFA pattern. This generally means the image is color, but it could also mean that processing has been applied to remove the effects of the CFA pattern and still be a single band, or that the result is a multispectral image. The algorithm used to decode the pattern is indicated by the processing_algorithm attribute in the Color_Filter_Array class.

Indicates the image is not and has never been CFA encoded. In this case, Color_Filter_Array would simply not be present in the label. This value is present in case it needs to be explicitly stated that there is no CFA.

DD_Attribute.name: color_filter_array_type
DD_Attribute.definition: Defines the type of Color Filter Array (CFA) used to encode multiple colors in a single exposure. The most common example of this is the Bayer pattern. This is optional if there is no CFA. Additional attributes, specific to each CFA type, define whether or not the CFA pattern has been removed, and if so, how (e.g. bayer_algorithm).

DD_Permissible_Value.value_meaning: The Bayer CFA pattern contains one red, one blue, and two green pixels in each 2x2 square of pixels. The RGGB type indicates the phasing of the colors, in the order upper left, upper right, lower left, and lower right. RGGB is the most common phasing but others are possible

DD_Attribute.name: color_space
DD_Attribute.definition: Defines the color space in which this product is expressed. Some color spaces (e.g. XYZ or xyY) are independent of illuminant, while for others (e.g. sRGB or pRGB) the illuminant matters. It is expected that the defined color spaces will increase over time.

DD_Permissible_Value.value_meaning: Instrument RGB. This is Red, Green, Blue color as it comes from the instrument, without any color correction.
Standard RGB, as defined by XXXXX. Corrected Red, Green, Blue color using a standard 5000K illuminant.
Planetary RGB. Corrected Red, Green, Blue color using an approximation of the actual illuminant at the planetary surface. For Mars missions this is typically 3000-4000K.
White Balanced RGB. Red, Green, Blue with a simple white balance applied.
Tristimulus values defined by CIE.
Chromaticity and luminance coordinates defined by CIE.
Hue, Saturation, Intensity

DD_Attribute.name: color_subsampling_mode
DD_Attribute.definition: The color_subsampling_mode attribute specifies the JPEG color subsampling mode used during compression. Valid values: '4:2:2' - 4:2:2 chroma subsampling, which is the typical case, '4:4:4' - 4:4:4 chroma sampling, which indicates no subsampling, 'Grayscale' - indicates a grayscale image

DD_Permissible_Value.value_meaning: Indicates 4:4:4 chroma sampling. Each of the three Y'CbCr components have the same sample rate, thus there is no chroma subsampling

indicates 4:2:2 chroma subsampling. The typical case. The two chroma components are sampled at half the sample rate of luma: the horizontal chroma resolution is halved. This reduces the bandwidth of an uncompressed video signal by one-third with little to no visual difference.
indicates a grayscale image

DD_Attribute.name: companding_state
DD_Attribute.definition: The companding_state attribute specifies whether the data is or has had its bit depth reduced, for example conversion from 12 to 8 bits via a lookup table or bit scaling. Valid values: None - values have not been companded. Companded - values are currently companded. Expanded - values have been companded but are now expanded back to original size.

DD_Permissible_Value.value_meaning: values have not been companded
values are currently companded
values have been companded but are now expanded back to original size

DD_Attribute.name: onboard_compression_class
DD_Attribute.definition: The onboard_compression_class attribute identifies the type of on-board compression used for data storage and transmission. Note that the onboard_compression_type identifies the specific compression algorithm used (for example, ICER), whereas the onboard_compression_class gives a simple indicator of the type of compression mode. Valid values: 'Lossless', 'Lossy', 'Uncompressed'

DD_Permissible_Value.value_meaning: TBD
TBD
TBD

DD_Attribute.name: onboard_compression_mode
DD_Attribute.definition: The onboard_compression_mode attribute identifies the method used for on-board compression of data. The value for this attributes represents the raw integer value for compression, which is then translated to the full name captured by the onboard_compression_type attribute.

DD_Attribute.name: onboard_compression_quality
DD_Attribute.definition: The onboard_compression_quality attribute is an indication of compression quality, in the range of 0.0 to 1.0. Losslessly compressed or uncompressed data have a value of 1.0. Other values are assigned in a manner specific to the compression mode, but with the property that a higher value means better quality. Although the values are not directly comparable across compression types, this facilitates comparison of compression quality across images independent of compression mode.

DD_Attribute.name: onboard_compression_rate
DD_Attribute.definition: The onboard_compression_rate attribute provides the average number of bits needed to represent a pixel for an on-board compressed image.

DD_Attribute.name: onboard_compression_ratio
DD_Attribute.definition: The onboard_compression_ratio attribute provides the ratio of the size, in bytes, of the original uncompressed data object to its compressed form (original size / compressed size).

DD_Attribute.name: onboard_compression_type
DD_Attribute.definition: The onboard_compression_type attribute identifies the type of on-board compression used for data storage and transmission. Valid Values: 'ICER', 'LOCO', 'JPEG', 'JPEG Progressive', 'MSSS Lossless', 'None'.

DD_Permissible_Value.value_meaning: ICER Adaptive Variable-Length Coding (ICER)
Integer Cosine Transform
Low-Complexity Lossless Compression
Joint Photographic Experts Group, an industry standard lossy compression algorithm.
interlaced progressive JPEG format, in which data is compressed in multiple passes of progressively higher detail.
Lossless compression algorithm developed by Malin Space Science Systems.
No on-board compression was used.

DD_Attribute.name: crosstrack_summing
DD_Attribute.definition: The crosstrack_summing attribute provides the number of detector pixel values in the crosstrack direction that have been averaged to produce the final output pixel.

DD_Attribute.name: current_value
DD_Attribute.definition: The current_value attribute provides provides the current, in the specified units, of an imaging instrument or some part of the imaging instrument.

DD_Attribute.name: decomposition_stages
DD_Attribute.definition: The decomposition_stages attribute identifies the number of stages of decomposition.

DD_Attribute.name: deferred_flag
DD_Attribute.definition: The deferred_flag attribute specifies whether compression was done at the time of image acquisition, or was deferred until later (typically at downlink time).

DD_Attribute.name: detector_erase_count
DD_Attribute.definition: The detector_erase_count specifies the number of times a detector has been or will be flushed of data in raw counts, dependent on the parent class for the attribute.

DD_Attribute.name: detector_first_line
DD_Attribute.definition: The detector_first_line attribute specifies the starting row from the hardware, such as a charge-coupled device (CCD), that contains data.

DD_Attribute.name: detector_first_sample
DD_Attribute.definition: The detector_first_sample attribute specifies the starting column from the hardware, such as a charge-coupled device (CCD), that contains data.

DD_Attribute.name: detector_lines
DD_Attribute.definition: The detector_lines attribute specifies the number of rows extracted from the hardware, such as a charge-coupled device (CCD), that contain data.

DD_Attribute.name: detector_to_image_rotation
DD_Attribute.definition: The detector_to_image_rotation attribute specifies the clockwise rotation, in degrees, that was applied to an image along its optical path through an instrument, from detector to final image orientation.

DD_Attribute.name: device_id
DD_Attribute.definition: The device_id attribute supplies the identifier of an imaging instrument, an imaging instrument device, or some point on the instrument or device.

DD_Attribute.name: device_name
DD_Attribute.definition: The device_name attribute supplies the formal name for an imaging instrument, an imaging instrument device, or some point on the instrument or device.

DD_Attribute.name: device_state
DD_Attribute.definition: The device_state attribute indicates the state of a sensor or other device associated with the imaging instrument. These states are interpreted in an instrument-specific way.

DD_Attribute.name: downtrack_summing
DD_Attribute.definition: The downtrack_summing attribute provides the number of detector pixel values in the downtrack direction that have been averaged to produce the final output pixel.

DD_Attribute.name: encoded_display_gamma
DD_Attribute.definition: Defines the gamma value encoded in this image. Gamma correction is used to nonlinearly compress the intensities in an image, and most display systems assume that images are encoded with an sRGB gamma. Note that this is a string value because the most common gamma correction ("sRGB") is not precisely expressible as a gamma exponent. A numeric value indicates a gamma exponent.

DD_Attribute.name: erase_count
DD_Attribute.definition: The erase_count specifies the number of times a detector has been or will be flushed of data in raw counts, dependent on the parent class for the attribute.

DD_Attribute.name: error_pixel_count
DD_Attribute.definition: The error_pixel_count attribute specifies the number of pixels that are outside a valid DN range, after all decompression and post decompression processing has been completed.

DD_Attribute.name: exposure_count
DD_Attribute.definition: The exposure count attribute provides the number of exposures taken during a certain interval, such as the duration of one command. For example, this may include the number of exposures needed by an autoexpose algorithm.

DD_Attribute.name: exposure_duration
DD_Attribute.definition: The exposure_duration attribute provides the amount of time the instrument sensor was gathering light from the scene, such as between opening and closing of a shutter, or between flushing and readout of a CCD.

DD_Attribute.name: exposure_duration_count
DD_Attribute.definition: The exposure_duration_count attribute specifies the value, in raw counts, for the amount of time the instrument sensor was gathering light from the scene, such as between opening and closing of a shutter, or between flushing and readout of a CCD. This is the raw count either commanded or taken directly from telemetry as reported by the spacecraft. This attribute is the same as the exposure_duration but in DN counts versus time, and the translation of exposure_duration_count to exposure_duration will differ by mission. The attribute can be specified in the context of both Imaging_Instrument_State_Parameters (actual value) and Command_Parameters (commanded value). Both commanded and actual because it's possible for the actual to not match the commanded. For example the exposure might fault out early, or there might be a deadband (for example, pointing backlash) where changes in the input do not actually affect the output.

DD_Attribute.name: exposure_duration_threshold_count
DD_Attribute.definition: The exposure_duration_threshold specifies the exposure time threshold in raw counts, when shutter_subtraction_mode = 'Conditional'.

DD_Attribute.name: exposure_type
DD_Attribute.definition: The exposure_type attribute indicates the exposure setting on a camera. Valid values: 'Manual' - manual exposure setting, 'Auto' - autoexposure is applied by the camera, 'Test' - test exposure setting telling the camera to return a fixed-pattern test image.

DD_Permissible_Value.value_meaning: manual exposure setting
autoexposure is applied by the camera
test exposure setting telling the camera to return a fixed-pattern test image.

DD_Attribute.name: filter_id
DD_Attribute.definition: The filter_id attribute provides a short string identifier for an instrument filter through which an image or measurement was acquired or which is associated with a given instrument mode.

DD_Attribute.name: filter_name
DD_Attribute.definition: The filter_name attribute provides the name, described in the mission documentation, of the instrument filter through which an image or measurement was acquired or which is associated with a given instrument mode.

DD_Attribute.name: filter_number
DD_Attribute.definition: The filter_number attribute provides the numeric identifier of an instrument filter through which an image or measurement was acquired or which is associated with a given instrument mode.

DD_Attribute.name: first_line
DD_Attribute.definition: The first_line attribute indicates the line within a source image that corresponds to the first line in a sub-image.

DD_Attribute.name: first_sample
DD_Attribute.definition: The first_sample attribute indicates the sample within a source image that corresponds to the first sample in a sub-image.

DD_Attribute.name: focus_merge_blending_flag
DD_Attribute.definition: The focus_merge_blending_flag attribute indicates whether intra-stack image blending has been performed during a focus merge operation. A value of 'false' means images were merged without blending.

DD_Attribute.name: focus_merge_registration_flag
DD_Attribute.definition: The focus_merge_registration_flag attribute indicates whether intra-stack image registration has been performed during a focus merge operation. A value of 'true' indicates that intra-stack image registration has been performed during the focus merge operation, while 'false' indicates that images have been merged without translation.

DD_Attribute.name: focus_mode
DD_Attribute.definition: The focus_mode attribute specifies the type of focus command, for example: Autofocus, Manual, ZStack, or Relative (focus adjustment based on a previous autofocus).

DD_Permissible_Value.value_meaning: The focus was commanded by the autofocus algorithm.
The exact focus position was set manually.
Images were acquired at multiple autofocus positions.
A focus adjustment was made relative to a previous position.

DD_Attribute.name: focus_position
DD_Attribute.definition: The focus_position attribute defines, in a camera-specific way, the focus metric that should be used for geometric processing of the data (e.g. for creating camera models). This will often be the focus motor count.

DD_Attribute.name: focus_position_count
DD_Attribute.definition: The focus_position_count attribute specifies a commanded focus, or the initial focus position used by the autofocus algorithm.

DD_Attribute.name: focus_stack_flag
DD_Attribute.definition: The focus_stack_flag attribute indicates whether or not focus stack image products were created during the autofocus imaging step.

DD_Attribute.name: frame_count
DD_Attribute.definition: The frame_count attribute indicates the total number of image frames acquired, such as for a video or focus stack observation.

DD_Attribute.name: frame_id
DD_Attribute.definition: The frame_id attribute specifies an identification for a particular instrument measurement frame. A frame consists of a sequence of measurements made over a specified time interval, and may include measurements from different instrument modes. These sequences repeat from cycle to cycle and sometimes within a cycle.

DD_Attribute.name: frame_interval
DD_Attribute.definition: The frame_interval attribute defines the time between the start of successive frames in a video product.

DD_Attribute.name: frame_rate
DD_Attribute.definition: The frame_rate attribute specifies the calculated frame rate for video products.

DD_Attribute.name: frame_type_name
DD_Attribute.definition: The frame_type_name attribute specifies whether the image was commanded as part of a stereo pair or as a single left or right monoscopic image. If frame_type = 'Stereo', a left and a right image should be present.

DD_Attribute.name: gain_mode_id
DD_Attribute.definition: The gain_mode_id attribute identifies the gain state of an instrument. Gain is a constant value which is multiplied with an instrument's output signal to increase or decrease the level of that output. These modes may vary by mission so the permissible values should be set by the mission dictionaries.

DD_Attribute.name: gain_number
DD_Attribute.definition: The gain_number attribute specifies the gain value used in the analog to digital conversion. The gain value is a multiplicative factor used in the analog to digital conversion.

DD_Attribute.name: gop_frame_count
DD_Attribute.definition: The gop_frame_count attribute indicates, for video products compressed into a group of images (Group Of Pictures or GOP), the number of images in a GOP. This is not necessarily the total number of frames in the observation (see frame_count), as the observation may consist of a number of GOPs.

DD_Attribute.name: gop_frame_index
DD_Attribute.definition: The gop_frame_index attribute specifies the frame index within a Group Of Pictures (GOP).

DD_Attribute.name: height_pixels
DD_Attribute.definition: The height_pixels attribute provides the vertical dimension, in pixels.

DD_Attribute.name: icer_quality
DD_Attribute.definition: The icer_quality attribute is a ICER specific variable for on-board ICER data compression.

DD_Attribute.name: id
DD_Attribute.definition: The id attribute supplies a short name (identifier) for the associated value in a group of related values.

DD_Attribute.name: illuminant
DD_Attribute.definition: Defines the illuminant that was used in order to process this image. The valid values are open-ended but examples of valid values include: None, D65, 3000K, 5000K.

DD_Attribute.name: interframe_delay
DD_Attribute.definition: The interframe_delay attribute provides the time between the end of one frame and the beginning of the next frame in a video product.

DD_Attribute.name: jpeg_parameter
DD_Attribute.definition: The jpeg_parameter attribute is a JPEG specific variable which specifies on-board compression determination by image quality or by compression factor, based on a selected on-board compression mode.

DD_Attribute.name: jpeg_quality
DD_Attribute.definition: The jpeg_quality attribute is a JPEG specific variable which identifies the resultant or targeted image quality index for on-board data compression.

DD_Attribute.name: lines
DD_Attribute.definition: The lines attribute indicates the total number of data instances along the vertical axis of an image or sub-image.

DD_Attribute.name: line_fov
DD_Attribute.definition: The line_fov attribute specifies the angular measure of the field of view of an imaged scene, as measured in the image line direction (generally vertical).

DD_Attribute.name: maximum_focus_distance
DD_Attribute.definition: The maximum_focus_distance attribute specifies the estimated distance to the farthest pixel with less than 1 pixel of gaussian blur.

DD_Attribute.name: minimum_focus_distance
DD_Attribute.definition: The minimum_focus_distance attribute specifies the estimated distance to the nearest pixel with less than 1 pixel of gaussian blur.

DD_Attribute.name: missing_pixel_count
DD_Attribute.definition: The missing_pixel_count attribute identifies the total number of missing pixels defined by the image or image segment.

DD_Attribute.name: motor_count
DD_Attribute.definition: The motor_count attribute specifies the raw motor counts for the specified device, which indicates the position of the associated mechanism in a device-specific way.

DD_Attribute.name: onboard_B_b
DD_Attribute.definition: Specifies the factor that has been multiplied by the B pixel value after de-Bayering (demosaicking) takes place. This value is summed with the multiplied R and G pixel values to produce the output Blue value.

DD_Attribute.name: onboard_B_g
DD_Attribute.definition: Specifies the factor that has been multiplied by the G pixel value after de-Bayering (demosaicking) takes place. This value is summed with the multiplied R and B pixel values to produce the output Blue value.

DD_Attribute.name: onboard_B_r
DD_Attribute.definition: Specifies the factor that has been multiplied by the R pixel value after de-Bayering (demosaicking) takes place. This value is summed with the multiplied G and B pixel values to produce the output Blue value.

DD_Attribute.name: onboard_G_b
DD_Attribute.definition: Specifies the factor that has been multiplied by the B pixel value after de-Bayering (demosaicking) takes place. This value is summed with the multiplied R and G pixel values to produce the output Green value.

DD_Attribute.name: onboard_G_g
DD_Attribute.definition: Specifies the factor that has been multiplied by the G pixel value after de-Bayering (demosaicking) takes place. This value is summed with the multiplied R and B pixel values to produce the output Green value.

DD_Attribute.name: onboard_G_r
DD_Attribute.definition: Specifies the factor that has been multiplied by the R pixel value after de-Bayering (demosaicking) takes place. This value is summed with the multiplied G and B pixel values to produce the output Green value.

DD_Attribute.name: onboard_R_b
DD_Attribute.definition: Specifies the factor that has been multiplied by the B pixel value after de-Bayering (demosaicking) takes place. This value is summed with the multiplied R and G pixel values to produce the output Red value.

DD_Attribute.name: onboard_R_g
DD_Attribute.definition: Specifies the factor that has been multiplied by the G pixel value after de-Bayering (demosaicking) takes place. This value is summed with the multiplied R and B pixel values to produce the output Red value.

DD_Attribute.name: onboard_R_r
DD_Attribute.definition: Specifies the factor that has been multiplied by the R pixel value after de-Bayering (demosaicking) takes place. This value is summed with the multiplied G and B pixel values to produce the output Red value.

DD_Attribute.name: processing_algorithm
DD_Attribute.definition: The processing_algorithm attribute specifies the name of the algorithm used to perform the processing specified by the enclosing class. Algorithm names should be defined in the project documentation, and/or in the enclosing class definition.

DD_Attribute.name: processing_venue
DD_Attribute.definition: The processing_venue attribute specifies where the processing described by the parent class was performed. Value values: "Onboard Hardware" - processing was done by hardware onboard the spacecraft, such as inside the camera. "Onboard Software" - processing was done by flight software onboard the spacecraft. "Onboard Both" - processing was done onboard by both hardware and software. "Onboard" - processing was done onboard (hardware or software is unspecified). "Ground" - processing was done on the ground. "Ground Refined" - onboard processing was reversed and new ground processing was applied (for example, removing a synthetic flat field from onboard processing and replacing it with a true flat field). "None" - processing has not been done.

DD_Attribute.name: progressive_stage
DD_Attribute.definition: The progressive_stage attribute specifies TBD

DD_Attribute.name: r0
DD_Attribute.definition: The r0 attribute specifies a parameter for Radial_Flat_Field_Function.

DD_Attribute.name: r1
DD_Attribute.definition: The r1 attribute specifies a parameter for Radial_Flat_Field_Function.

DD_Attribute.name: r2
DD_Attribute.definition: The r2 attribute specifies a parameter for Radial_Flat_Field_Function.

DD_Attribute.name: r3
DD_Attribute.definition: The r3 attribute specifies a parameter for Radial_Flat_Field_Function.

DD_Attribute.name: radiance_zenith_scaling_factor
DD_Attribute.definition: Defines the scaling factor used for Scaled Radiance or Scaled Spectral Radiance. Scaled radiance is created by dividing radiance by this factor, which scales the radiance to what it would be if the sun were at the zenith with a clear atmosphere.

DD_Attribute.name: radiance_type
DD_Attribute.definition: The radiance_type defines the specific type of radiance measurement. Possible values include "Radiance", "Spectral Radiance", "Scaled Spectral Radiance". Note: There are many more possible values, and this definition can be updated to include more examples over time.

DD_Attribute.name: raw_count
DD_Attribute.definition: The raw_count attribute provides the value of some parameter measured by a spacecraft or instrument sensor in the raw units reported by that sensor. A separate attribute should be included alongside the raw_count that translates this value into the appropriate engineering units. i.e. temperature_value in degrees C or voltage_value in Volts

DD_Attribute.name: readout_rate
DD_Attribute.definition: The readout_rate attribute specifies the clock rate at which values are read from the sensor.

DD_Attribute.name: responsivity_factor_b
DD_Attribute.definition: Specifies the factor that has been applied to the B cell of the Bayer pattern, before de-Bayering (demosaicking) takes place.

DD_Attribute.name: responsivity_factor_g
DD_Attribute.definition: Specifies the factor that has been applied to the G cell of the Bayer pattern, before de-Bayering (demosaicking) takes place.

DD_Attribute.name: responsivity_factor_r
DD_Attribute.definition: Specifies the factor that has been applied to the R cell of the Bayer pattern, before de-Bayering (demosaicking) takes place.

DD_Attribute.name: responsivity_b
DD_Attribute.definition: Specifies the conversion factor between DN and radiance units that has been applied to the blue channel of an image.

DD_Attribute.name: responsivity_g
DD_Attribute.definition: Specifies the conversion factor between DN and radiance units that has been applied to the green channel of an image.

DD_Attribute.name: responsivity_pan
DD_Attribute.definition: Specifies the conversion factor between DN and radiance units that has been applied to a panchromatic image.

DD_Attribute.name: responsivity_r
DD_Attribute.definition: Specifies the conversion factor between DN and radiance units that has been applied to the red channel of an image.

DD_Attribute.name: samples
DD_Attribute.definition: The samples attribute indicates the total number of data instances along the horizontal axis of an image or sub-image.

DD_Attribute.name: sample_bit_mask
DD_Attribute.definition: The sample_bit_mask attribute Specifies the active bits in a sample. Any bit mask is valid in an non-raw product. Any 8-bit product, whether a scaled raw product or other, will have the value "2#11111111" and be stored in one byte. Any 12-bit product, whether an unscaled raw product, or an ILUT partially-processed product (see companding_method), will have the value "2#0000111111111111" and be stored in two bytes. A 15-bit product (e.g. Radiometrically-corrected Calibrated product type) will have the value "2#0111111111111111" and be stored in two bytes. Any 32-bit integer product (e.g. Histogram Raw product) will have the value "2#11111111111111111111111111111111" and be stored in four bytes. For floating-point data, sample_bit_mask is not valid and may be absent. If present, it should be ignored. NOTE: In the PDS, the domain of sample_bit_mask is dependent upon the currently-described value in the sample_bits attribute and only applies to integer values.

DD_Attribute.name: sample_bits
DD_Attribute.definition: The sample_bits attribute specifies the logical or active number of bits in the data, which is distinct from the physical number of bits (for example, encoding 12-bit data within 16-bit words). These logical bits are stored in the low order (least significant) bits, with unused bits filled with 0 (or 1 for negative integers to preserve a two's complement representation). This is distinct from the valid data range (specified by valid_minimum and valid_maximum in Special_Constants class) because all values, including missing/invalid flag values, must fit within the sample_bits. The intent is that the data should be able to be sent through a communication channel that passes only sample_bits with no loss in fidelity.

DD_Attribute.name: sample_fov
DD_Attribute.definition: The sample_fov attribute specifies the angular measure of the field of view of an imaged scene, as measured in the image sample direction (generally horizontal).

DD_Attribute.name: sampling_factor
DD_Attribute.definition: The sampling_factor attribute provides the value N, where every Nth data point was kept from the original data set by selection, averaging, or taking the median. When applied to an image object, the single value represented in sampling_factor applies to both the lines and the samples.

DD_Attribute.name: sequence_number
DD_Attribute.definition: The sequence_number attribute supplies the sequence identifier for the associated value in a group of related values.

DD_Attribute.name: segment_count
DD_Attribute.definition: The segment_count attribute identifies the number of segments into which the image was partitioned for error containment purposes.

DD_Attribute.name: segment_number
DD_Attribute.definition: The segment_number attribute identifies which compression segment is described in the current Segment class.

DD_Attribute.name: segment_quality
DD_Attribute.definition: The segment_quality attribute identifies the resultant or targeted image quality index for on-board ICER data compression. Upon return by the ICER decompress function, the output quantity segment_quality provides an indication of the quality of the reconstructed segment. Specifically, the value returned is a double for which the integer values correspond to attained min loss values, but in general is an interpolation between these values. Thus lower values of segment_quality correspond to higher reconstructed qualities, and a value of indicates lossless compression. Note that the compressed stream does not directly contain the value of min loss that was given to the compressor, but the decompressor does know how far along in the decompression process it got before it ran out of bits; this information is used to determine segment_quality. In rare circumstances the decompressor m ay not be able to determine segment_quality for a segment that it decompresses. In this case it sets segment_quality to 1.0. The reconstructed segment might be either lossy or lossless when this occurs. The technical condition under which a quality value is not determined is that the decompressor runs out of the data for the segment before decoding any bit plane information.

DD_Attribute.name: segment_status
DD_Attribute.definition: The segment_status attribute provides a bit mask which provides the status of decoding for the compression segment identified by segment_number. Upon return by the ICER decompress function, the output quantity of segment_status contains a number indicating the decode status. The decode status may have one or more of the following flags set: SHORTDATASEG FLAG (bit 0): If this flag is set, then the segment contained so little data that nothing could be reconstructed in the segment. INCONSISTENTDATA FLAG (bit 1): If this flag is set, then one or more pieces of information in the segment header (specifically, image width, image height, n segs, wavelet filter, n decomps) are inconsistent with the value(s) in the first (valid) segment. ICER will ignore the data in this segment. DUPLICATESEG FLAG (bit 2): If this flag is set, then the segment index given in the header equals that given by a previous segment. The decompressor will ignore the data in this segment. BADBITPLANENUMBER FLAG (bit 3): If this flag is set, then an ICER internal parameter in the header for this segment has probably been corrupted. The decompressor will ignore the data in this segment. BADBITPLANECOUNT FLAG (bit 4): If this flag is set, then an ICER internal parameter in the header for this segment has probably been corrupted. The decompressor will ignore the data in this segment. BADDATA FLAG (bit 5): If this flag is set, then either the parameter combination given in the header for this segment are not allowed by ICER, or the segment number is bad. This probably indicates corrupted data. The decompressor will ignore the data in this segment.

DD_Attribute.name: shutter_subtraction_mode
DD_Attribute.definition: The shutter_subtraction_mode specifies whether shutter subtraction will be performed, or if it is dependent on the exposure_duration_threshold_count.

DD_Permissible_Value.value_meaning: shutter subtraction will be performed
the exposure_duration_threshold_count will determine whether or not shutter subtraction will be performed

DD_Attribute.name: subframe_type
DD_Attribute.definition: The subframe_type attribute specifies the method of subframing performed on the image. These methods may vary by mission so the permissible values should be set by the mission dictionaries. Example values from MSL include a) 'Software Only' - Software processsing only. b) 'Hardware Compatible' - Use hardware only if compatible. c) 'Hardware Else Software' - Use hardware then software. d) 'Subframe Around Sun' - If the sun is found, send a subframed image of the sun. If sun is not found, send back no image.

DD_Attribute.name: temperature_status
DD_Attribute.definition: The temperature_status attribute defines the status of the associated temperature measurement. The status is interpreted in a device-specific way, but generally 0 indicates a successful measurement.

DD_Attribute.name: temperature_value
DD_Attribute.definition: The temperature_value attribute provides the temperature, in the specified units, of some point on an imaging instrument or other imaging instrument device.

DD_Attribute.name: value_number
DD_Attribute.definition: The value_number attribute provides the value with no applicable units as named by the associated id, name, or sequence_number.

DD_Attribute.name: value_string
DD_Attribute.definition: The value_string attribute provides the value with no applicable units as named by the associated id, name, or sequence_number.

DD_Attribute.name: video_flag
DD_Attribute.definition: The video_flag attribute indicates whether or not video products were commanded.

DD_Attribute.name: voltage_value
DD_Attribute.definition: The voltage_value attribute provides provides the voltage, in the specified units, of an imaging instrument or some part of the imaging instrument.

DD_Attribute.name: wavelet_filter
DD_Attribute.definition: The wavelet_filter attribute specifies thefilter used in the compression and decompression algorithm.

DD_Attribute.name: width_pixels
DD_Attribute.definition: The width_pixels attribute provides the horizontal dimension, in pixels.

DD_Attribute.name: x_center
DD_Attribute.definition: The x_center attribute specifies a parameter for Radial_Flat_Field_Function.

DD_Attribute.name: y_center
DD_Attribute.definition: The y_center attribute specifies a parameter for Radial_Flat_Field_Function.

DD_Class.name: Imaging
DD_Class.definition: The Imaging class contains classes and attributes describing both the image product itself and the imaging instrument. Image product information can include exposure duration, filters, data correction, sampling, frame, sub-frames, and how the product was derived. For the imaging instrument, information can be provided describing the dynamic physical or operating characteristics of the imaging instrument.

DD_Class.name: Algorithm_Parameter
DD_Class.definition: The Algorithm_Parameter class provides a name and value(s) use for input into the autoexposure algorithm.

DD_Class.name: Autoexposure_Parameters
DD_Class.definition: The Autoexposure_Parameters class contains attributes used to identify or describe the histogram thresholding algorithm and applicable attributes required for those algorithms. The input parameters for the algorithm can be specified using the Algorithm_Parameter class or via a Local_Internal_Reference to a mission-specific parameter definition.

DD_Class.name: Color_Filter_Array
DD_Class.definition: The Color_Filter_Array class describes whether or not an image was acquired using a Color Filter Array (CFA) and if so, whether and how the CFA pattern was removed. A CFA is a method for making color images using one exposure on a single sensor plane, where microfilters of different wavelengths are put in front of pixels in a specific pattern. The most common pattern is the Bayer pattern, which has a red, blue, and two green pixels in every 2x2 pixel square. Although generally used for RGB color, CFA filters can be of any number and wavelength (see color_filter_array_type).

DD_Class.name: Color
DD_Class.definition: The Color class contains parameters describing color correction or processing and how the image is represented in color.

DD_Class.name: Commanded_Parameters
DD_Class.definition: The Command_Parameters class contains attributes used to identify or describe the commands sent to a spacecraft to perform one or more actions resulting in the acquisition of the current data product. These are distinct from similar values in the root Imaging class which indicate the state of the image as acquired.

DD_Class.name: Companding
DD_Class.definition: The Companding class describes whether or not data is or has had its bit depth reduced (for example conversion from 12 to 8 bits via a lookup table or bit scaling), the venue where it occurred (Software or Hardware), and the method used to complete the companding. The processing_algorithm attribute specifies how data was companded. Generally this will either be via a lookup table (such as a square root encoding), or by shifting bits to preserve the high order bits and discard the low order bits. The value of this keyword is mission specific but there are recommended values that should apply across missions when possible: NONE - no scaling. LUTn - use the numbered lookup table. Lookup tables are defined in the mission SIS. It is preferred for "n" to be a number but it could be a name, for example LUT_MMM_3 to indicate LUT 3 for the MMM instruments (on MSL). MSB_BITn - Shift to make bit "n" the most significant. Bits start numbering at 0 so MSB_BIT7 means no shift for a 12->8 bit companding, while MSB_BIT11 means to shift right 4 bits for a 12->8 bit companding. AUTOSHIFT - Data should be shifted to preserve the highest value. This value should only appear in a command echo; one of the MSB_BITn values should be used in downlinked data to specify what the actual shift was.

DD_Class.name: Onboard_Compression_Parameters
DD_Class.definition: The Onboard_Compression_Parameters class contains attributes describing onboard compression parameters used for data storage and transmission.

DD_Class.name: Correction_Parameter
DD_Class.definition: The Correction_Parameter class specifies identifier(s) and value for a data correction parameter applicable to the parent class.

DD_Class.name: Data_Processing
DD_Class.definition: The Data_Processing class specifies describes details regarding the calibration and/or processing performed on the data product. This class can be used to describe various data corrections, such as antiblooming, bad pixel replacement, blemish protection, dark current correction, or shutter correction. This can be specified multiple times in order to detail numerous corrections, and should be used to designate PDS3-like flag attributes, such as dark_current_correction_flag and flat_field_correction_flag.

DD_Class.name: Data_Processing_File
DD_Class.definition: The Data_Processing_File class specifies a file containing calibration data that was applied to the science data as part of a Data Correction. If more than one file applies to a given Data_Correction, the name/id/sequence_number identifies the type of file.

DD_Class.name: Detector_Parameters
DD_Class.definition: The Detector_Parameters class contains attributes describing the state of the instrument detector.

DD_Class.name: Device_Component_States
DD_Class.definition: The Device_Component_States class provides a container for the set of states of a component of an imaging instrument or other imaging device.

DD_Class.name: Device_Component_State
DD_Class.definition: The Device_Component_State class describes the state of one component of an imaging instrument or other imaging device. The meaning of "state" is device-specific.

DD_Class.name: Device_Currents
DD_Class.definition: The Device_Currents class provides a container for the set of currents of an imaging instrument or other imaging device.

DD_Class.name: Device_Current
DD_Class.definition: The Device_Current class provides the current of some point on an imaging instrument or other imaging device.

DD_Class.name: Device_Motor_Counts
DD_Class.definition: The Device_Motor_Counts class provides a container for the set of raw motor counts of actuators on an imaging instrument or other imaging device (such as a filter wheel, focus motor, or zoom motor).

DD_Class.name: Device_Motor_Count
DD_Class.definition: The Device_Motor_Count class describes the raw motor count of one actuator on an imaging instrument or other imaging device (such as a filter wheel, focus motor, or zoom motor). This information should typically be reported in a more specific and useable form in other classes, such as a filter number or wavelength in the Filter_Parameters class or a focus distnace in the Focus_Parameters class.

DD_Class.name: Device_Parameters
DD_Class.definition: The Device_Parameters class identifies where a measurement was made. It may refer to an individual imaging instrument, imaging instrument device, or some defined point on the instrument or device. The class is intended to be extended (for example, by Device_Temperature) to add the associated measurement rather than being used directly.

DD_Class.name: Device_Temperatures
DD_Class.definition: The Device_Temperatures class provides a container for the set of temperatures of an imaging instrument or other imaging device.

DD_Class.name: Device_Temperature
DD_Class.definition: The Device_Temperature class provides a container for the temperature of some point on an imaging instrument or other imaging device.

DD_Class.name: Device_Voltages
DD_Class.definition: The Device_Voltage class provides a container for the set of voltages of an imaging instrument or other imaging device.

DD_Class.name: Device_Voltage
DD_Class.definition: The Device_Voltage class provides the voltage of some point on an imaging instrument or other imaging device.

DD_Class.name: Downsampling
DD_Class.definition: The Downsampling class describes whether or not downsampling occurred, the venue where it occurrected (Software or Hardware), the method used to downsample, and the pixel averaging dimensions. A downsampled image is a smaller version of the image, resulting in reduced resolution of the same coverage area. The processing_algorithm attribute specifies the pixel resolution downsample method used. This varies by mission, but examples from MSL include: 'Mean' - Downsampling done in software by calculation of the mean., 'Conditional' - Use hardware binning if downsampling (by mean calculation) and subframe arguments are consistent.

DD_Class.name: Exposure_Parameters
DD_Class.definition: The Exposure_Parameters class contains attributes identifying the image instrument exposure configuration and image exposure values. As a child of the Image_Product_Information class, these attribute values identify the actual exposure values when the image was taken. As a child of the Command_Parameters class, these attribute values are those that were commanded to the spacecraft at the time the image was taken.

DD_Class.name: Filter_Parameters
DD_Class.definition: The Filter_Parameters class describes the filter associated with a particular observation. The filter may be identified by name, identifier, number or some combination of these.

DD_Class.name: Flat_Field_Correction
DD_Class.definition: The Flat_Field_Correction class specifies the onboard flat-field coefficients/parameters used in the algorithm to remove the flat field signature.

DD_Class.name: Flat_Field_File
DD_Class.definition: The Flat_Field_File class specifies the image used for flat field correction. The image is divided by this flat field image in order to apply the flat field correction (which is the opposite of Radial_Flat_Field_Function).

DD_Class.name: Focus_Parameters
DD_Class.definition: The Focus_Parameters class contains attributes that describe the focus or autofocus parameters for an observation. As a child of Commanded_Parameters, these indicate the focus settings used to command the instrument. Otherwise, they indicate the actual focus used by the observation.

DD_Class.name: Focus_Stack_Parameters
DD_Class.definition: The Focus_Stack_Parameters class contains attributes that describe a set of images taken at different focus settings, which are often merged to create a best-focus image or combined to extract range information. Focus stacks are also sometimes called ZStacks.

DD_Class.name: Frame_Parameters
DD_Class.definition: The Frame_Parameters class contains attributes providing information specific to an image frame. A frame consists of a sequence of measurements made over a specified time interval, and may include measurements from different instrument modes.

DD_Class.name: ICER_Parameters
DD_Class.definition: The ICER_Parameters class contains attributes describing onboard compression parameters specific to Joint Photographic Experts Group (JPEG) image compression. ICER is a wavelet-based image compression file format used by the NASA Mars Rovers. ICER has both lossy and lossless compression modes.

DD_Class.name: Image_Compression_Segment
DD_Class.definition: The Image_Compression_Segment class provides attributes describing each segment into which data was partitioned for error containment purposes as part of the compression process.

DD_Class.name: Instrument_State_Parameters
DD_Class.definition: The Instrument_State_Parameters class contains classes providing the values of any dynamic physical or operating characteristics of the imaging instruments.

DD_Class.name: JPEG_Parameters
DD_Class.definition: The JPEG_Parameters class contains attributes describing onboard compression parameters specific to Joint Photographic Experts Group (JPEG) image compression.

DD_Class.name: JPEG_Progressive_Parameters
DD_Class.definition: The JPEG_Progressive_Parameters class contains attributes describing an interlaced progressive JPEG format, in which data is compressed in multiple passes of progressively higher detail. This is ideal for large images that will be displayed while downloading over a slow connection, allowing a reasonable preview after receiving only a portion of the data.

DD_Class.name: List_Index_No_Units_Imaging
DD_Class.definition: Used when the list values have no units.

DD_Class.name: LOCO_Parameters
DD_Class.definition: The LOCO_Parameters class contains attributes describing onboard compression parameters specific to Low Complexity Lossless Compression (LOCO) image compression, a lossless submode of ICER

DD_Class.name: Onboard_Color_Matrix
DD_Class.definition: The Onboard_Color_Matrix class represents a 3x3 matrix that is used onboard to perform color correction. It is done after de-Bayering, as all three color bands are needed for each pixel. The first three elements are multiplied by the R,G,B (respectively) pixel values and summed to get the output Red pixel value. Similarly, the second three create the output Green, and the last three the output Blue. If the label is not present, no correction was performed.

DD_Class.name: Onboard_Responsivity
DD_Class.definition: The Onboard_Responsivity class specifies factors that have been applied to the R, G, and B cells (respectively) of the Bayer pattern, before de-Bayering (demosaicking) takes place. The intent of these is to approximately balance the filters so the de-Bayering process is not skewed, and EDR/ILT products look reasonable before full radiometric or color correction is done on the ground. If these factors are not present, no correction was performed.

DD_Class.name: Pixel_Averaging_Dimensions
DD_Class.definition: The Pixel_Averaging class provides the height and width, in pixels, of the area over which pixels were averaged prior to image compression.

DD_Class.name: Radial_Flat_Field_Function
DD_Class.definition: The Radial_Flat_Field_Function class pecifies parameters used to generate a synthetic flat field using a simple radial function of the form: r = (x-x_center)^2 + (y-y_center)^2 ; flat_field(x,y) = 1 + r0 + r1*r + r2*r^2 + r3*r^3 . Note that x is in the sample direction of the image, and y is in the line direction. The image is multiplied by this function in order to perform a flat field correction (which is the opposite of Flat_Field_File).

DD_Class.name: Radiometric_Correction
DD_Class.definition: The Radiometric_Correction class is a container for the type and details of the radiometric calibration performed on the product.

DD_Class.name: Sampling_Parameters
DD_Class.definition: The Sampling_Parameters class contains attributes and classes related to the sampling, scaling, companding, and compression or reduction in resolution of data.

DD_Class.name: Shutter_Subtraction
DD_Class.definition: The Shutter_Subtraction class specifies attributes describing the removal from the image of the shutter, or fixed-pattern.

DD_Class.name: Subframe_Parameters
DD_Class.definition: The Subframe_Parameters class describes the position and other optional characteristics of an image subframe, relative to the original image.

DD_Class.name: Video_Parameters
DD_Class.definition: The Video_Parameters class contains attributes related to video observations, defined as a regular time series of frames. The class can be used to describe a single frame within the video, or the video as a whole.

DD_Rule_Statement.rule_message: IMG:error:imaging_child_check: img:Imaging class must contain at least 1 attribute or class specified.
In img:Imaging, Local_Internal_Reference.local_reference_type must be equal to 'imaging_parameters_to_image_object'.
IMG:error:internal_reference_type_check_autoexposure: In img:Autoexposure_Parameters, Internal_Reference.reference_type must be equal to 'data_to_document'.
IMG:error:internal_reference_type_check_data_correction: In img:Data_Processing_File, the Internal_Reference.reference_type must be equal to 'data_to_data_processing_file'.
IMG:error:detector_params_child_check: img:Detector_Parameters must have at least 1 attribute or class specified.
IMG:error:command_params_child_check: img:Command_Parameters must have at least 1 attribute or class specified.
IMG:error:sampling_params_child_check: img:Sampling_Parameters must have at least 1 attribute or class specified.
IMG:error:frame_params_child_check: img:Frame_Parameters must have at least 1 attribute or class specified.
IMG:error:subframe_params_child_check: img:Subframe_Parameters must have at least 1 attribute or class specified.
IMG:error:color_params_child_check: img:color must have at least 1 attribute or class specified.
IMG:error:downsampling_params_child_check: img:Downsampling must have at least 1 attribute or class specified.
IMG:error:exposure_params_child_check: img:Exposure_Parameters must have at least 1 attribute or class specified.
IMG:error:focus_params_child_check: img:Focus_Parameters must have at least 1 attribute or class specified.
IMG:error:focus_stack_params_child_check: img:Focus_Stack_Parameters must have at least 1 attribute or class specified.
IMG:error:video_params_child_check: img:Video_Parameters must have at least 1 attribute or class specified.
IMG:error:packet_params_child_check: img:Packet_Parameters must have at least 1 attribute or class specified.
IMG:error:inst_times_child_check: img:Instrument_Time_Values must have at least 1 attribute or class specified.
IMG:error:filter_params_child_check: img:Filter_Parameters must have at least 1 attribute or class specified.
IMG:error:cmprs_params_child_check: img:Compression_Parameters must have at least 1 attribute or class specified.
IMG:error:jpeg_params_child_check: img:JPEG_Parameters must have at least 1 attribute or class specified.
IMG:error:loco_params_child_check: img:LOCO_Parameters must have at least 1 attribute or class specified.
IMG:error:icer_params_child_check: img:ICER_Parameters must have at least 1 attribute or class specified.
IMG:error:inst_state_params_child_check: img:Instrument_State_Parameters must have at least 1 attribute or class specified.
IMG:error:image_data_params_child_check: img:Image_Product_Parameters must have at least 1 attribute or class specified.
IMG:error:derived_params_child_check: img:Derived_Parameters must have at least 1 attribute or class specified.
IMG:error:img:color_filter_array_state_check: img:demosaicing_algorithm attribute must be specified when img:color_filter_array_state = 'Decoded'.
IMG:error:icer_comprs_segment_check: img:ICER_Parameters/img:segment_count must match the number of img:Image_Compression_Segment classes.
IMG:error:radiometric_corr_check: Both img:radiance_offset and img:radiance_zenith_scaling_factor must exist together.
IMG:error:shutter_subtraction_check: if img:shutter_subtraction_mode = 'Conditional', then img:exposure_duration_threshold_count must exist.
IMG:error:exposure_duration_check: img:exposure_duration must be specified in the img:Instrument_State_Parameters/img:Exposure_Parameters class.
IMG:error:focus_command_check: *_focus_distance keywords should be in img:Derived_Parameters/img:Focus_Parameters.

DD_Rule_Statement.rule_test: not(img:focus_mode) and not(img:focus_position_count) and not(img:autofocus_step_size) and not(img:autofocus_step_count) and not(img:focus_stack_flag) and not(img:Focus_Stack_Parameters)
DD_Rule_Statement.rule_message: IMG:error:focus_derived_check: commanding focus parameters should be in img:Command_Parameters/img:Focus_Parameters.
IMG:error:autoexposure_inst_state_check: Autoexposure_Parameters should be in img:Command_Parameters/img:Exposure_Parameters.
IMG:error:subframe_command_check1: derived subframe parameters should be in img:Derived_Parameters/img:Subframe_Parameters.
IMG:error:subframe_command_check2: img:Command_Parameters/img:Subframe_Parameters must include all of img:first_line, img:first_sample, img:lines, img:samples

DD_Rule_Statement.rule_test: not(img:first_line) and not(img:first_sample) and not(img:lines) and not(img:samples) and not(pds:name) and not(pds:description) and not(img:subframe_type)
DD_Rule_Statement.rule_message: IMG:error:subframe_derived_check: commanding subframe parameters should be in img:Command_Parameters/img:Subframe_Parameters.
IMG:error:detector_inst_state_check: derived parameters should be in img:Derived_Parameters/img:Detector_Parameters.

DD_Rule_Statement.rule_test: not(img:first_line) and not(img:first_sample) and not(img:lines) and not(img:samples) and not(img:detector_to_image_rotation) and not(img:erase_count) and not(img:readout_rate) and not(img:gain_mode_id) and not(img:gain_number) and not(img:analog_offset)
DD_Rule_Statement.rule_message: IMG:error:detector_derived_check: detector state parameters should be in img:Instrument_State_Parameters/img:Detector_Parameters.
In img:Autoexposure_Parameters, Local_Internal_Reference.local_reference_type must be equal to 'to_mission_autoexposure_parameters'.
In img:Data_Processing_File, the Internal_Reference.reference_type must be equal to 'data_to_data_processing_file'.
IMG:error:product_identification_child_check: img:Product_Identification class must contain at least 1 attribute or class specified.
IMG:error:img_inst_state_params_child_check: img:Imaging_Instrument_State_Parameters class must contain at least 1 attribute or class specified.
IMG:error:jpeg_comprs_child_check: img:JPEG_Parameters must have at least 1 attribute or class specified.
IMG:error:loco_comprs_child_check: img:LOCO_Parameters must have at least 1 attribute or class specified.
IMG:error:icer_comprs_child_check: img:ICER_Parameters must have at least 1 attribute or class specified.
IMG:error:img_inst_state_child_check: img:Imaging_Instrument_State_Parameters must have at least 1 attribute or class specified.

DD_Rule_Statement.rule_test: (img:color_filter_array_state = 'Decoded' and img:color_filter_array_type = 'Bayer RGGB' and exists(img:bayer_algorithm)) or img:color_filter_array_state = 'No CFA' or img:color_filter_array_state = 'Encoded'
DD_Rule_Statement.rule_message: IMG:error:img:color_filter_array_state_check: img:bayer_algorithm attribute must be specified when img:color_filter_array_state = 'Decoded' and img:color_filter_array_type = 'Bayer RGGB'.
IMG:error:icer_comprs_segment_check: img:ICER_Compression_Parameters/img:segment_count must match the number of img:Image_Compression_Segment classes.
IMG:error:radiometric_corr_check: Both img:radiance_offset and img:radiance_zenith_scaling_factor must exist together.
IMG:error:shutter_subtraction_check: if img:shutter_subtraction_mode = 'Conditional', then img:exposure_duration_threshold_count must exist.
IMG:error:exposure_duration_check: img:exposure_duration must be specified in img:Exposure_Parameters class
IMG:error:commanded_exposure_parameters_check: img:Exposure_Parameters must have at least 1 attribute or class specified.
IMG:error:frame_parameters_check: img:Frame_Parameters must have at least 1 attribute or class specified.
insight:log:cmd_params_0: Validating img:Command_Parameters class
insight:error:exp_params_0: The attribute img:exposure_duration_count must be within the value range 0-65535 inclusive.
insight:error:exp_params_1: The attribute img:exposure_type must be equal to one of the following values: 'MANUAL', 'AUTO', 'TEST'.
insight:log:inst_device_temp_0: Validating img:Instrument_Device_Temperature class
insight:error:inst_device_temp_1: The class img:Instrument_Device_Temperature must have exactly 2 img:Instrument_Device_Temperature_Index subclasses.

insight:error:inst_device_temp_2: The img:name values for the Instrument_Device_Temperature_Index classes must be either combination of 'IDC_CCD' and 'IDC_ELECTRONICS' or 'ICC_CCD' and 'ICC_ELECTRONICS'.
img:log:subframe_params_0: Validating img:Subframe_Parameters class
img:error:subframe_params_1: The attributes img:first_line and img:first_sample must each have values equal to '1'.
IMG:error:detector_inst_state_check: derived parameters should be in img:Derived_Parameters/img:Detector_Parameters.
